Question.Quest: The Solids percentage in the flotation feed is 30% and the dry tonnages fed are 600 t/h. How much water is fed?
This mineral’s density is 4.2 t/m3, it contains on average 35% copper, 30% iron and 35% sulphur.
Final concentrate contains 24.7 % Cu and 35.0 % Fe. In the circuit feed there is1.2 % Cu and in circuit tail – 0.08 % Cu. What are circuit’s mass pull and recovery?
Which one is true about reagents and air bubbles in flotation?
Question.Alternative1: Frother is used in order to increase size of air bubbles
Question.Alternative2: pH change has a big effect on bubble size
Question.Alternative3: Collector is used to increase bubble size
Question.Alternative4: Frother is used in order to decrease bubble size

Question.Quest: The flotation feed grade is decreasing. What should be done in order to keep the target metal grade in concentrate?
Question.Alternative2: Increase air addition to flotation circuit
Question.Alternative5: Nothing, automation system will take care of everything

Question.Quest: What is the purpose of the rotor in flotation?
Question.Alternative4: Rotor increases the power of collector

Pyrite is a:
What is the typical average particle size of a copper flotation feed?
What will happen if slurry temperature in flotation feed goes above 60 ℃?
Question.Alternative4: Evaporation from flotation cells will increase significantly
Question.Alternative5: Flotation cell rubber lining will have lower wear

Question.Quest: If the feed rate into a flotation cell is 600 m3/ h and the average residence time is 12 min, what is the size of the cell? (concentrate mass pull is small, air occupies c. 20% volume)

The head grade is 1.2% Cu, the mass pull is 5%, concentrate grade is 10%. What is the grade of the rougher tail?
What is typical residence time in rougher + scavenger line in sulphide flotation? (including conditioners)
Which one of the following statements about flotation cell duties is true?
Question.Alternative2: Rougher concentrate grade is about the same as in the cleaner tail
Question.Alternative3: Cleaner concentrate has a higher grade than rougher concentrate
Question.Alternative4: Cleaner tail is normally sent to Scavenger
Question.Alternative5: Rougher tail is sent to Cleaners

Question.Quest: What is a typical Solids percentage of the Rougher tail?
The concentrate Cu grade decreases from the target value. What would be the right thing to do to get it back to the target value?
Which one of the following statements is true about Outotec TankCells?
Question.Alternative2: Tank Cell is usually called forced air flotation cell
Question.Alternative3: The largest available TankCell is 100 m3
Question.Alternative4: TankCells can not be used in Cleaner circuit
Question.Alternative5: TankCells can process very coarse material (> 1 mm)

Question.Quest: The 1st Rougher’s cell level set point is changed from -150mm to -100 mm (this means decrease froth depth) and the froth in the 2nd Rougher stops (froth speed measured by froth cameras is zero). What should be done?
Question.Alternative1: Change the level set point back to -150 mm

Question.Quest: Which one of the following statements is true about froth thickness in flotation cell?
Question.Alternative1: Froth thickness is controlled by adjusting feed rate
Question.Alternative2: Froth thickness is controlled by adjusting tailing valve
Question.Alternative3: Froth thickness is controlled by collector
Question.Alternative4: Froth thickness is controlled by frother
Question.Alternative5: Froth thickness is controlled by air

Question.Quest: Why mixing is needed in flotation?
Question.Alternative1: To deliver high amount of air deep into the tank

Question.Quest: Which one of the following actions makes the froth more watery in flotation?
Question.Alternative2: Increasing the size of the froth crowder
